venue.name: Clink Restaurant at The Liberty Hotel Boston

item.description:
Come mingle with Sitz friends and guests in the chic rotunda bar and lounge of the Liberty Hotel at the foot of historic Beacon Hill.

The Liberty Hotel, a National Historic building, was the home of the Charles Street Jail, which housed a number of famous inmates including James Michael Curley, Malcolm X, and Sacco and Venzetti.

We’ll gather at the 2nd floor Clink Bar in the 90 foot tall atrium. Originally four wings containing over 200 8 by 10 foot cells extended from this atrium segregating the prisoners by sex and category of offense.

Light appetizers will be provided compliments of the Sitzundjibers Social Club.

 

Directions:

The hotel is conveniently located directly across the street from the Red Line MBTA Charles Street/MGH station.

If you are driving you may take Storrow Drive West to the Government Center exit (left exit). Enter the Charles Street rotary and follow the signs for Storrow Drive West. You will go through the subway underpass. Take a left and the Hotel will be on your right. You may park at the Mass Eye and Ear parking lot. The entrance is just past the Hotel and Storrow drive on ramp.
item.name: An Afterwork: Feeling "Naughty"? How about spending an evening in prison?
